snippet: Copper Beech Farm in Greenwich, on the market for $190 million, has been yoked, through its loans and through its owner, to a tale of the American West.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column; Copper Beech Farm, built in 1898 in Greenwich, Conn, is listing for $190 million, and when it hit market in May was proclaimed most expensive home ever formally listed in nation; estate, however, also carries more than $120 million in debt, surely making it one of the most heavily mortgaged homes in American history.

byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy and Jack Styczynski contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Copper Beech Farm in Greenwich, on the market for $190 million, has been yoked, through its loans and through its owner, to a tale of the American West.

headline.main: Burdened Estate Bears Monumental Price Tag, and Many Mortgages
headline.print_headline: Burdened Estate Bears Monumental Price Tag, And Many Mortgages
